066/**
067 * CLI subcommand to execute actor-IaC workflows.
068 *
069 * <p>This is the main workflow execution command. It supports executing workflows
070 * defined in YAML, JSON, or XML format with optional overlay configuration.</p>
071 *
072 * <h2>Usage</h2>
073 * <pre>
074 * actor-iac run -d /path/to/workflows -w main-workflow.yaml
075 * actor-iac run --dir ./workflows --workflow deploy --threads 8
076 * actor-iac run -d ./workflows -w deploy -i inventory.ini -g webservers
077 * </pre>
078 *
079 * @author devteam@scivics-lab.com
080 * @since 2.10.0
081 */
082@Command(
083    name = "run",
084    mixinStandardHelpOptions = true,
085    version = "actor-IaC run 2.12.1",
086    description = "Execute actor-IaC workflows defined in YAML, JSON, or XML format."
087)
088public class RunCLI implements Callable<Integer> {
089
090    private static final Logger LOG = Logger.getLogger(RunCLI.class.getName());
091    private static final String ACTORIAC_VERSION = "2.12.1";
092
093    @Option(
094        names = {"-d", "--dir"},
095        description = "Base directory (logs are created here). Defaults to current directory.",
096        defaultValue = "."
097    )
098    private File workflowDir;
099
100    @Option(
101        names = {"-w", "--workflow"},
102        description = "Workflow file path relative to -d (required)",
103        required = true
104    )
105    private String workflowName;
106
107    @Option(
108        names = {"-i", "--inventory"},
109        description = "Path to Ansible inventory file (enables node-based execution)"
110    )
111    private File inventoryFile;
112
113    @Option(
114        names = {"-g", "--group"},
115        description = "Name of the host group to target (requires --inventory)",
116        defaultValue = "all"
117    )
118    private String groupName;
119
120    @Option(
121        names = {"-t", "--threads"},
122        description = "Number of worker threads for CPU-bound operations (default: ${DEFAULT-VALUE})",
123        defaultValue = "4"
124    )
125    private int threads;
126
127    @Option(
128        names = {"-v", "--verbose"},
129        description = "Enable verbose output"
130    )
131    private boolean verbose;
132
133    @Option(
134        names = {"-o", "--overlay"},
135        description = "Overlay directory containing overlay-conf.yaml for environment-specific configuration"
136    )
137    private File overlayDir;
138
139    @Option(
140        names = {"--file-log", "-l", "--log"},
141        description = "Enable text file logging and specify output path. If not specified, only database logging is used."
142    )
143    private File logFile;
144
145    @Option(
146        names = {"--no-file-log", "--no-log"},
147        description = "Explicitly disable text file logging. (Text logging is disabled by default.)"
148    )
149    private boolean noLog;
150
151    @Option(
152        names = {"--log-db"},
153        description = "H2 database path for distributed logging (default: actor-iac-logs in current directory)"
154    )
155    private File logDbPath;
156
157    @Option(
158        names = {"--no-log-db"},
159        description = "Disable H2 database logging"
160    )
161    private boolean noLogDb;
162
163    @Option(
164        names = {"--log-serve"},
165        description = "H2 log server address (host:port, e.g., localhost:29090). " +
166                     "Enables multiple workflows to share a single log database. " +
167                     "Falls back to embedded mode if server is unreachable."
168    )
169    private String logServer;
170
171    @Option(
172        names = {"--embedded"},
173        description = "Use embedded H2 database mode. " +
174                     "Default behavior is to auto-start a TCP server with auto-shutdown."
175    )
176    private boolean embedded;
177
178    @Option(
179        names = {"-k", "--ask-pass"},
180        description = "Prompt for SSH password (uses password authentication instead of ssh-agent)"
181    )
182    private boolean askPass;
183
184    @Option(
185        names = {"--limit"},
186        description = "Limit execution to specific hosts (comma-separated, e.g., '192.168.5.15' or '192.168.5.15,192.168.5.16')"
187    )
188    private String limitHosts;
189
190    @Option(
191        names = {"-L", "--list-workflows"},
192        description = "List workflows discovered under --dir and exit"
193    )
194    private boolean listWorkflows;
195
196    @Option(
197        names = {"-q", "--quiet"},
198        description = "Suppress all console output (stdout/stderr). Logs are still written to database."
199    )
200    private boolean quiet;
201
202    @Option(
203        names = {"--cowfile", "-c"},
204        description = "Cowsay character to use for step display. " +
205                     "Available: tux, dragon, stegosaurus, kitty, bunny, turtle, elephant, " +
206                     "ghostbusters, vader, and 35 more. Use '--cowfile list' to see all."
207    )
208    private String cowfile;
209
210    @Option(
211        names = {"--render-to"},
212        description = "Render overlay-applied workflows to specified directory (does not execute)"
213    )
214    private File renderToDir;
215
216    @Option(
217        names = {"--max-steps", "-m"},
218        description = "Maximum number of state transitions allowed (default: ${DEFAULT-VALUE}). " +
219                     "Use a smaller value for debugging to prevent infinite loops.",
220        defaultValue = "10000"
221    )
222    private int maxSteps;
223
224    /** Cache of discovered workflow files: name -> File */
225    private final Map<String, File> workflowCache = new HashMap<>();
226
227    /** Distributed log store (H2 database) */
228    private DistributedLogStore logStore;
229
230    /** Actor reference for the log store (for async writes) */
231    private ActorRef<DistributedLogStore> logStoreActor;
232
233    /** Dedicated executor service for DB writes */
234    private ExecutorService dbExecutor;
235
236    /** Current session ID for distributed logging */
237    private long sessionId = -1;
238
239    /**
240     * Executes the workflow.
241     *
242     * @return exit code (0 for success, non-zero for failure)
243     */
244    @Override
245    public Integer call() {
246        // Handle --cowfile list: show available cowfiles and exit
247        if ("list".equalsIgnoreCase(cowfile)) {
248            printAvailableCowfiles();
249            return 0;
250        }
251
252        // Validate --dir is required for all other operations
253        if (workflowDir == null) {
254            System.err.println("Missing required option: '--dir=<workflowDir>'");
255            CommandLine.usage(this, System.err);
256            return 2;
257        }
258
259        // Validate required options
260        // --render-to only requires --dir and --overlay, not --workflow
261        if (renderToDir != null) {
262            if (overlayDir == null) {
263                if (!quiet) {
264                    System.err.println("--render-to requires '--overlay=<overlayDir>'");
265                    CommandLine.usage(this, System.err);
266                }
267                return 2;
268            }
269        } else if (workflowName == null && !listWorkflows) {
270            if (!quiet) {
271                System.err.println("Missing required option: '--workflow=<workflowName>'");
272                System.err.println("Use --list-workflows to see available workflows.");
273                CommandLine.usage(this, System.err);
274            }
275            return 2;
276        }
277
278        // In quiet mode, suppress all console output
279        if (quiet) {
280            suppressConsoleOutput();
281        }
282
283        // Configure log level based on verbose flag
284        configureLogLevel(verbose);
285
286        // Setup H2 log database (enabled by default, use --no-log-db to disable)
287        if (!noLogDb) {
288            if (logDbPath == null) {
289                // Default: actor-iac-logs in current directory
290                logDbPath = new File("actor-iac-logs");
291            }
292            try {
293                setupLogDatabase();
294            } catch (SQLException e) {
295                if (!quiet) {
296                    System.err.println("Warning: Failed to setup log database: " + e.getMessage());
297                }
298            }
299        }
300
301        // Setup text file logging via H2LogStore (only when -l/--log option is specified)
302        if (logFile != null && logStore != null) {
303            try {
304                setupTextLogging();
305            } catch (IOException e) {
306                if (!quiet) {
307                    System.err.println("Warning: Failed to setup text file logging: " + e.getMessage());
308                }
309            }
310        }
311
312        try {
313            return executeMain();
314        } finally {
315            // Clean up resources (H2LogStore.close() also closes text log writer)
316            if (logStore != null) {
317                try {
318                    logStore.close();
319                } catch (Exception e) {
320                    System.err.println("Warning: Failed to close log database: " + e.getMessage());
321                }
322            }
323        }
324    }
325
326    /**
327     * Suppresses all console output (stdout/stderr) for quiet mode.
328     */
329    private void suppressConsoleOutput() {
330        // Remove ConsoleHandler from root logger
331        Logger rootLogger = Logger.getLogger("");
332        for (java.util.logging.Handler handler : rootLogger.getHandlers()) {
333            if (handler instanceof java.util.logging.ConsoleHandler) {
334                rootLogger.removeHandler(handler);
335            }
336        }
337
338        // Redirect System.out and System.err to null
339        java.io.PrintStream nullStream = new java.io.PrintStream(java.io.OutputStream.nullOutputStream());
340        System.setOut(nullStream);
341        System.setErr(nullStream);
342    }
343
344    /**
345     * Sets up H2 database for distributed logging.
346     *
347     * <p>Connection priority:</p>
348     * <ol>
349     *   <li>If --embedded is specified, use embedded mode</li>
350     *   <li>If --log-serve is specified, connect to that server</li>
351     *   <li>Otherwise (default): auto-detect or start a background TCP server with auto-shutdown</li>
352     * </ol>
353     */
354    private void setupLogDatabase() throws SQLException {
355        Path dbPath = logDbPath.toPath();
356
357        // Priority 1: Explicit embedded mode
358        if (embedded) {
359            logStore = new H2LogStore(dbPath);
360            System.out.println("Log database: " + logDbPath.getAbsolutePath() + ".mv.db (embedded mode)");
361            return;
362        }
363
364        // Priority 2: Explicit log server specified
365        if (logServer != null && !logServer.isBlank()) {
366            logStore = H2LogStore.createWithFallback(logServer, dbPath);
367            System.out.println("Log database: " + logServer + " (TCP mode)");
368            return;
369        }
370
371        // Priority 3 (default): Auto-detect existing server or start a new one
372        LogServerDiscovery discovery = new LogServerDiscovery();
373        LogServerDiscovery.DiscoveryResult result = discovery.discoverServer(dbPath);
374
375        if (result.isFound()) {
376            // Found existing server, connect to it
377            logStore = H2LogStore.createWithFallback(result.getServerAddress(), dbPath);
378            System.out.println("Auto-detected log server at " + result.getServerAddress());
379            System.out.println("Log database: " + result.getServerAddress() + " (TCP mode)");
380            return;
381        }
382
383        // No existing server found - start a background server with auto-shutdown
384        int serverPort = startBackgroundLogServer(dbPath);
385        if (serverPort > 0) {
386            String serverAddress = "localhost:" + serverPort;
387            logStore = H2LogStore.createWithFallback(serverAddress, dbPath);
388            System.out.println("Started background log server on port " + serverPort);
389            System.out.println("Log database: " + serverAddress + " (TCP mode, auto-shutdown enabled)");
390        } else {
391            // Failed to start server, fall back to embedded mode
392            System.out.println("Warning: Failed to start background log server, using embedded mode");
393            logStore = new H2LogStore(dbPath);
394            System.out.println("Log database: " + logDbPath.getAbsolutePath() + ".mv.db (embedded mode)");
395        }
396    }
397
398    /** Background log server process (for auto-shutdown) */
399    private Process backgroundServerProcess;
400
401    /** Background log server port */
402    private int backgroundServerPort = -1;
403
404    /**
405     * Starts a background H2 log server with auto-shutdown.
406     *
407     * <p>The server runs in a separate process and will automatically shut down
408     * when there are no connections for 5 minutes.</p>
409     *
410     * @param dbPath database path
411     * @return the TCP port of the started server, or -1 if failed
412     */
413    private int startBackgroundLogServer(Path dbPath) {
414        // Find an available port in the reserved range
415        int port = findAvailablePort();
416        if (port < 0) {
417            LOG.warning("No available ports in range 29090-29100");
418            return -1;
419        }
420
421        try {
422            // Get the path to actor_iac.java
423            String actorIacPath = findActorIacScript();
424            if (actorIacPath == null) {
425                LOG.warning("Could not find actor_iac.java script");
426                return -1;
427            }
428
429            // Build the command to start log server with auto-shutdown
430            ProcessBuilder pb = new ProcessBuilder(
431                actorIacPath,
432                "log-serve",
433                "--port", String.valueOf(port),
434                "--db", dbPath.toAbsolutePath().toString(),
435                "--auto-shutdown",
436                "--idle-timeout", "300",  // 5 minutes
437                "--check-interval", "60"   // Check every 1 minute
438            );
439
440            // Redirect output to null (server runs silently in background)
441            pb.redirectOutput(ProcessBuilder.Redirect.DISCARD);
442            pb.redirectError(ProcessBuilder.Redirect.DISCARD);
443
444            // Start the server process
445            backgroundServerProcess = pb.start();
446            backgroundServerPort = port;
447
448            // Wait briefly for server to start
449            Thread.sleep(1000);
450
451            // Verify server is running
452            if (!backgroundServerProcess.isAlive()) {
453                LOG.warning("Background log server process exited unexpectedly");
454                return -1;
455            }
456
457            // Verify we can connect
458            LogServerDiscovery.DiscoveryResult verify = new LogServerDiscovery().discoverServer(dbPath);
459            if (!verify.isFound()) {
460                LOG.warning("Background log server started but not responding");
461                backgroundServerProcess.destroy();
462                return -1;
463            }
464
465            if (verbose) {
466                LOG.info("Background log server started on port " + port + " (PID: " + backgroundServerProcess.pid() + ")");
467            }
468
469            return port;
470
471        } catch (Exception e) {
472            LOG.warning("Failed to start background log server: " + e.getMessage());
473            return -1;
474        }
475    }
476
477    /**
478     * Finds an available port in the actor-IaC reserved range (29090-29100).
479     */
480    private int findAvailablePort() {
481        int[] ports = {29090, 29091, 29092, 29093, 29094, 29095, 29096, 29097, 29098, 29099, 29100};
482        for (int port : ports) {
483            try (java.net.Socket socket = new java.net.Socket("localhost", port)) {
484                // Port is in use
485            } catch (Exception e) {
486                // Port is available
487                return port;
488            }
489        }
490        return -1;
491    }
492
493    /**
494     * Finds the path to the actor_iac.java script.
495     */
496    private String findActorIacScript() {
497        // Try common locations
498        String[] candidates = {
499            "./actor_iac.java",
500            "../actor_iac.java",
501            System.getProperty("user.dir") + "/actor_iac.java",
502            workflowDir.getParent() + "/actor_iac.java"
503        };
504
505        for (String path : candidates) {
506            java.io.File file = new java.io.File(path);
507            if (file.exists() && file.canExecute()) {
508                return file.getAbsolutePath();
509            }
510        }
511
512        // Try to find via PATH
513        try {
514            ProcessBuilder pb = new ProcessBuilder("which", "actor_iac.java");
515            Process p = pb.start();
516            try (java.io.BufferedReader reader = new java.io.BufferedReader(
517                    new java.io.InputStreamReader(p.getInputStream()))) {
518                String line = reader.readLine();
519                if (line != null && !line.isBlank()) {
520                    return line.trim();
521                }
522            }
523        } catch (Exception e) {
524            // Ignore
525        }
526
527        return null;
528    }
529
530    /**
531     * Sets up text file logging via H2LogStore.
532     *
533     * <p>This method configures the H2LogStore to also write log entries
534     * to a text file, in addition to the H2 database. Only called when
535     * -l/--log option is explicitly specified.</p>
536     */
537    private void setupTextLogging() throws IOException {
538        Path logFilePath = logFile.toPath();
539
540        // Configure H2LogStore to also write to text file
541        ((H2LogStore) logStore).setTextLogFile(logFilePath);
542
543        LOG.info("Text logging enabled: " + logFilePath);
544    }
545
546    /**
547     * Configures log level based on verbose flag.
548     */
549    private void configureLogLevel(boolean verbose) {
550        Level targetLevel = verbose ? Level.FINER : Level.INFO;
551
552        // Try to load logging.properties from classpath if verbose mode
553        if (verbose) {
554            try (java.io.InputStream is = getClass().getClassLoader().getResourceAsStream("logging.properties")) {
555                if (is != null) {
556                    LogManager.getLogManager().readConfiguration(is);
557                    LOG.info("Loaded logging.properties from classpath");
558                }
559            } catch (java.io.IOException e) {
560                LOG.fine("Could not load logging.properties: " + e.getMessage());
561            }
562        }
563
564        // Configure root logger level
565        Logger rootLogger = Logger.getLogger("");
566        rootLogger.setLevel(targetLevel);
567
568        // Configure handlers to respect the new level
569        for (java.util.logging.Handler handler : rootLogger.getHandlers()) {
570            handler.setLevel(targetLevel);
571        }
572
573        // Configure POJO-actor loggers for tracing
574        Logger interpreterLogger = Logger.getLogger("com.scivicslab.pojoactor.workflow.Interpreter");
575        interpreterLogger.setLevel(targetLevel);
576        Logger actorSystemLogger = Logger.getLogger("com.scivicslab.pojoactor.workflow.IIActorSystem");
577        actorSystemLogger.setLevel(targetLevel);
578        Logger genericIIARLogger = Logger.getLogger("com.scivicslab.pojoactor.workflow.DynamicActorLoaderActor$GenericIIAR");
579        genericIIARLogger.setLevel(targetLevel);
580
581        if (verbose) {
582            LOG.info("Verbose mode enabled - log level set to FINER (tracing enabled)");
583        }
584    }
585
586    /**
587     * Main execution logic.
588     */
589    private Integer executeMain() {
590        // Validate workflow directory
591        if (!workflowDir.exists()) {
592            LOG.severe("Workflow directory does not exist: " + workflowDir);
593            return 1;
594        }
595
596        if (!workflowDir.isDirectory()) {
597            LOG.severe("Not a directory: " + workflowDir);
598            return 1;
599        }
600
601        // Scan workflow directory recursively
602        LOG.info("Scanning workflow directory: " + workflowDir.getAbsolutePath());
603        scanWorkflowDirectory(workflowDir.toPath());
604
605        if (verbose) {
606            LOG.info("Discovered " + workflowCache.size() + " workflow files:");
607            workflowCache.forEach((name, file) ->
608                LOG.info("  " + name + " -> " + file.getPath()));
609        }
610
611        if (listWorkflows) {
612            printWorkflowList();
613            return 0;
614        }
615
616        // Handle --render-to option
617        if (renderToDir != null) {
618            return renderOverlayWorkflows();
619        }
620
621        if (workflowName == null || workflowName.isBlank()) {
622            LOG.severe("Workflow name is required unless --list-workflows is specified.");
623            return 1;
624        }
625
626        // Find main workflow
627        File mainWorkflowFile = findWorkflowFile(workflowName);
628        if (mainWorkflowFile == null) {
629            LOG.severe("Workflow not found: " + workflowName);
630            LOG.info("Available workflows: " + workflowCache.keySet());
631            return 1;
632        }
633
634        // Validate overlay directory if specified
635        if (overlayDir != null) {
636            if (!overlayDir.exists()) {
637                LOG.severe("Overlay directory does not exist: " + overlayDir);
638                return 1;
639            }
640            if (!overlayDir.isDirectory()) {
641                LOG.severe("Overlay path is not a directory: " + overlayDir);
642                return 1;
643            }
644        }
645
646        LOG.info("=== actor-IaC Workflow CLI ===");
647        LOG.info("Workflow directory: " + workflowDir.getAbsolutePath());
648        LOG.info("Main workflow: " + mainWorkflowFile.getName());
649        if (overlayDir != null) {
650            LOG.info("Overlay: " + overlayDir.getAbsolutePath());
651        }
652        LOG.info("Worker threads: " + threads);
653
654        // Execute workflow (use local inventory if none specified)
655        return executeWorkflow(mainWorkflowFile);
656    }
657
658    /**
659     * Renders overlay-applied workflows to the specified directory.
660     */
661    private Integer renderOverlayWorkflows() {
662        if (overlayDir == null) {
663            LOG.severe("--render-to requires --overlay to be specified");
664            return 1;
665        }
666
667        try {
668            // Create output directory if it doesn't exist
669            if (!renderToDir.exists()) {
670                if (!renderToDir.mkdirs()) {
671                    LOG.severe("Failed to create output directory: " + renderToDir);
672                    return 1;
673                }
674            }
675
676            LOG.info("=== Rendering Overlay-Applied Workflows ===");
677            LOG.info("Overlay directory: " + overlayDir.getAbsolutePath());
678            LOG.info("Output directory: " + renderToDir.getAbsolutePath());
679
680            WorkflowKustomizer kustomizer = new WorkflowKustomizer();
681            Map<String, Map<String, Object>> workflows = kustomizer.build(overlayDir.toPath());
682
683            org.yaml.snakeyaml.Yaml yaml = new org.yaml.snakeyaml.Yaml();
684
685            for (Map.Entry<String, Map<String, Object>> entry : workflows.entrySet()) {
686                String fileName = entry.getKey();
687                Map<String, Object> workflowContent = entry.getValue();
688
689                Path outputPath = renderToDir.toPath().resolve(fileName);
690
691                // Add header comment
692                StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
693                sb.append("# Rendered from overlay: ").append(overlayDir.getName()).append("\n");
694                sb.append("# Source: ").append(fileName).append("\n");
695                sb.append("# Generated: ").append(LocalDateTime.now()).append("\n");
696                sb.append("#\n");
697                sb.append(yaml.dump(workflowContent));
698
699                Files.writeString(outputPath, sb.toString());
700                LOG.info("  Written: " + outputPath);
701            }
702
703            LOG.info("Rendered " + workflows.size() + " workflow(s) to " + renderToDir.getAbsolutePath());
704            return 0;
705
706        } catch (IOException e) {
707            LOG.severe("Failed to render workflows: " + e.getMessage());
708            return 1;
709        } catch (Exception e) {
710            LOG.severe("Error during rendering: " + e.getMessage());
711            e.printStackTrace();
712            return 1;
713        }
714    }
715
716    /**
717     * Executes workflow with node-based execution.
718     */
719    private Integer executeWorkflow(File mainWorkflowFile) {
720        NodeGroup nodeGroup;
721
722        // Prompt for password if --ask-pass is specified
723        String sshPassword = null;
724        if (askPass) {
725            sshPassword = promptForPassword("SSH password: ");
726            if (sshPassword == null) {
727                LOG.severe("Password input cancelled");
728                return 1;
729            }
730        }
731
732        IIActorSystem system = new IIActorSystem("actor-iac-cli", threads);
733
734        // Add dedicated thread pool for DB writes (single thread to serialize writes)
735        system.addManagedThreadPool(1);
736        dbExecutor = system.getManagedThreadPool(1);
737
738        // Create logStore actor if log database is configured
739        if (logStore != null) {
740            logStoreActor = system.actorOf("logStore", logStore);
741
742            // Start log session with execution context
743            String overlayName = overlayDir != null ? overlayDir.getName() : null;
744            String inventoryName = inventoryFile != null ? inventoryFile.getName() : null;
745
746            // Collect execution context for reproducibility
747            String cwd = System.getProperty("user.dir");
748            String gitCommit = getGitCommit(workflowDir);
749            String gitBranch = getGitBranch(workflowDir);
750            String commandLine = buildCommandLine();
751            String actorIacVersion = ACTORIAC_VERSION;
752            String actorIacCommit = getActorIacCommit();
753
754            sessionId = logStore.startSession(workflowName, overlayName, inventoryName, 1,
755                    cwd, gitCommit, gitBranch, commandLine, actorIacVersion, actorIacCommit);
756            logStore.log(sessionId, "cli", LogLevel.INFO, "Starting workflow: " + workflowName);
757        }
758
759        try {
760            if (inventoryFile != null) {
761                // Use specified inventory file
762                if (!inventoryFile.exists()) {
763                    LOG.severe("Inventory file does not exist: " + inventoryFile);
764                    logToDb("cli", LogLevel.ERROR, "Inventory file does not exist: " + inventoryFile);
765                    return 1;
766                }
767                LOG.info("Inventory: " + inventoryFile.getAbsolutePath());
768                nodeGroup = new NodeGroup.Builder()
769                    .withInventory(new FileInputStream(inventoryFile))
770                    .build();
771            } else {
772                // Use empty NodeGroup for local execution
773                LOG.info("Inventory: (none - using localhost)");
774                nodeGroup = new NodeGroup();
775            }
776
777            // Set SSH password if provided
778            if (sshPassword != null) {
779                nodeGroup.setSshPassword(sshPassword);
780                LOG.info("Authentication: password");
781            } else {
782                LOG.info("Authentication: ssh-agent");
783            }
784
785            // Set host limit if provided
786            if (limitHosts != null) {
787                nodeGroup.setHostLimit(limitHosts);
788                LOG.info("Host limit: " + limitHosts);
789            }
790
791            // Step 1: Create NodeGroupInterpreter
792            NodeGroupInterpreter nodeGroupInterpreter = new NodeGroupInterpreter(nodeGroup, system);
793            // Set workflow base dir to the directory containing the main workflow file
794            // so that sub-workflows can be found relative to the main workflow
795            File workflowBaseDir = mainWorkflowFile.getParentFile();
796            if (workflowBaseDir == null) {
797                workflowBaseDir = workflowDir;
798            }
799            nodeGroupInterpreter.setWorkflowBaseDir(workflowBaseDir.getAbsolutePath());
800            if (overlayDir != null) {
801                nodeGroupInterpreter.setOverlayDir(overlayDir.getAbsolutePath());
802            }
803            if (verbose) {
804                nodeGroupInterpreter.setVerbose(true);
805            }
806            // Create IaCStreamingAccumulator for cowsay display
807            IaCStreamingAccumulator accumulator = new IaCStreamingAccumulator();
808            if (cowfile != null && !cowfile.isBlank()) {
809                accumulator.setCowfile(cowfile);
810            }
811            nodeGroupInterpreter.setAccumulator(accumulator);
812
813            // Inject log store into interpreter for node-level logging
814            if (logStore != null) {
815                nodeGroupInterpreter.setLogStore(logStore, logStoreActor, dbExecutor, sessionId);
816            }
817
818            // Step 2: Create NodeGroupIIAR and register with system
819            NodeGroupIIAR nodeGroupActor = new NodeGroupIIAR("nodeGroup", nodeGroupInterpreter, system);
820            system.addIIActor(nodeGroupActor);
821
822            // Step 2.5: Create and register MultiplexerAccumulatorIIAR
823            MultiplexerAccumulator multiplexer = new MultiplexerAccumulator();
824
825            // Add ConsoleAccumulator (unless --quiet is specified)
826            if (!quiet) {
827                multiplexer.addTarget(new ConsoleAccumulator());
828            }
829
830            // Add FileAccumulator if --file-log is specified
831            if (logFile != null) {
832                try {
833                    multiplexer.addTarget(new FileAccumulator(logFile.toPath()));
834                    LOG.info("File logging enabled: " + logFile.getAbsolutePath());
835                } catch (IOException e) {
836                    LOG.warning("Failed to create file accumulator: " + e.getMessage());
837                }
838            }
839
840            // Add DatabaseAccumulator if log store is configured
841            if (logStoreActor != null && sessionId >= 0) {
842                multiplexer.addTarget(new DatabaseAccumulator(logStoreActor, dbExecutor, sessionId));
843                LOG.fine("Database logging enabled for session: " + sessionId);
844            }
845
846            // Register multiplexer actor with the system
847            MultiplexerAccumulatorIIAR multiplexerActor = new MultiplexerAccumulatorIIAR(
848                "outputMultiplexer", multiplexer, system);
849            system.addIIActor(multiplexerActor);
850            LOG.fine("MultiplexerAccumulator registered as 'outputMultiplexer'");
851
852            // Step 2.6: Create and register DynamicActorLoaderActor for plugin loading
853            DynamicActorLoaderActor loaderActor = new DynamicActorLoaderActor(system);
854            IIActorRef<DynamicActorLoaderActor> loaderRef = new IIActorRef<>("loader", loaderActor, system) {
855                @Override
856                public ActionResult callByActionName(String actionName, String args) {
857                    return loaderActor.callByActionName(actionName, args);
858                }
859            };
860            system.addIIActor(loaderRef);
861            LOG.fine("DynamicActorLoaderActor registered as 'loader'");
862
863            // Add log handler to forward java.util.logging to multiplexer
864            MultiplexerLogHandler logHandler = new MultiplexerLogHandler(system);
865            logHandler.setLevel(java.util.logging.Level.ALL);
866            java.util.logging.Logger.getLogger("").addHandler(logHandler);
867
868            // Step 3: Load the main workflow (with overlay if specified)
869            ActionResult loadResult = loadMainWorkflow(nodeGroupActor, mainWorkflowFile, overlayDir);
870            if (!loadResult.isSuccess()) {
871                LOG.severe("Failed to load workflow: " + loadResult.getResult());
872                logToDb("cli", LogLevel.ERROR, "Failed to load workflow: " + loadResult.getResult());
873                endSession(SessionStatus.FAILED);
874                return 1;
875            }
876
877            // Step 3.5: Create node actors if group is specified
878            if (groupName != null) {
879                LOG.info("Creating node actors for group: " + groupName);
880                logToDb("cli", LogLevel.INFO, "Creating node actors for group: " + groupName);
881                ActionResult createResult = nodeGroupActor.callByActionName("createNodeActors", "[\"" + groupName + "\"]");
882                if (!createResult.isSuccess()) {
883                    LOG.severe("Failed to create node actors: " + createResult.getResult());
884                    logToDb("cli", LogLevel.ERROR, "Failed to create node actors: " + createResult.getResult());
885                    endSession(SessionStatus.FAILED);
886                    return 1;
887                }
888                LOG.info("Node actors created: " + createResult.getResult());
889            }
890
891            // Step 4: Execute the workflow
892            LOG.info("Starting workflow execution...");
893            LOG.info("Max steps: " + maxSteps);
894            LOG.info("-".repeat(50));
895            logToDb("cli", LogLevel.INFO, "Starting workflow execution (max steps: " + maxSteps + ")");
896
897            long startTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
898            ActionResult result = nodeGroupActor.callByActionName("runUntilEnd", "[" + maxSteps + "]");
899            long duration = System.currentTimeMillis() - startTime;
900
901            LOG.info("-".repeat(50));
902            if (result.isSuccess()) {
903                LOG.info("Workflow completed successfully: " + result.getResult());
904                logToDb("cli", LogLevel.INFO, "Workflow completed successfully in " + duration + "ms");
905                endSession(SessionStatus.COMPLETED);
906                return 0;
907            } else {
908                LOG.severe("Workflow failed: " + result.getResult());
909                logToDb("cli", LogLevel.ERROR, "Workflow failed: " + result.getResult());
910                endSession(SessionStatus.FAILED);
911                return 1;
912            }
913
914        } catch (Exception e) {
915            LOG.log(Level.SEVERE, "Workflow execution failed", e);
916            logToDb("cli", LogLevel.ERROR, "Exception: " + e.getMessage());
917            endSession(SessionStatus.FAILED);
918            return 1;
919        } finally {
920            system.terminate();
921        }
922    }
923
924    /**
925     * Logs a message to the distributed log store if available.
926     */
927    private void logToDb(String nodeId, LogLevel level, String message) {
928        if (logStore != null && sessionId >= 0) {
929            logStore.log(sessionId, nodeId, level, message);
930        }
931    }
932
933    /**
934     * Ends the current session with the given status.
935     */
936    private void endSession(SessionStatus status) {
937        if (logStore != null && sessionId >= 0) {
938            logStore.endSession(sessionId, status);
939        }
940    }
941
942    /**
943     * Prompts for a password from the console.
944     */
945    private String promptForPassword(String prompt) {
946        java.io.Console console = System.console();
947        if (console != null) {
948            // Secure input - password not echoed
949            char[] passwordChars = console.readPassword(prompt);
950            if (passwordChars != null) {
951                return new String(passwordChars);
952            }
953            return null;
954        } else {
955            // Fallback for environments without console (e.g., IDE)
956            System.out.print(prompt);
957            try (java.util.Scanner scanner = new java.util.Scanner(System.in)) {
958                if (scanner.hasNextLine()) {
959                    return scanner.nextLine();
960                }
961            }
962            return null;
963        }
964    }
965
966    /**
967     * Scans the immediate directory for workflow files (non-recursive).
968     *
969     * @since 2.12.1
970     */
971    private void scanWorkflowDirectory(Path dir) {
972        try (Stream<Path> paths = Files.list(dir)) {
973            paths.filter(Files::isRegularFile)
974                 .filter(this::isWorkflowFile)
975                 .forEach(this::registerWorkflowFile);
976        } catch (IOException e) {
977            LOG.warning("Error scanning directory: " + e.getMessage());
978        }
979    }
980
981    /**
982     * Checks if a file is a workflow file (YAML, JSON, or XML).
983     */
984    private boolean isWorkflowFile(Path path) {
985        String name = path.getFileName().toString().toLowerCase();
986        return name.endsWith(".yaml") || name.endsWith(".yml") ||
987               name.endsWith(".json") || name.endsWith(".xml");
988    }
989
990    /**
991     * Registers a workflow file in the cache.
992     */
993    private void registerWorkflowFile(Path path) {
994        File file = path.toFile();
995        String fileName = file.getName();
996
997        // Register with full filename
998        workflowCache.put(fileName, file);
999
1000        // Register without extension
1001        int dotIndex = fileName.lastIndexOf('.');
1002        if (dotIndex > 0) {
1003            String baseName = fileName.substring(0, dotIndex);
1004            // Only register base name if not already taken by another file
1005            workflowCache.putIfAbsent(baseName, file);
1006        }
1007    }
1008
1009    /**
1010     * Finds a workflow file by path relative to workflowDir.
1011     *
1012     * <p>Supports paths like "sysinfo/main-collect-sysinfo.yaml" or
1013     * "sysinfo/main-collect-sysinfo" (extension auto-detected).</p>
1014     *
1015     * @param path workflow file path relative to workflowDir
1016     * @return the workflow file, or null if not found
1017     * @since 2.12.1
1018     */
1019    public File findWorkflowFile(String path) {
1020        // Resolve path relative to workflowDir
1021        File file = new File(workflowDir, path);
1022
1023        // Try exact path first
1024        if (file.isFile()) {
1025            return file;
1026        }
1027
1028        // Try with common extensions
1029        String[] extensions = {".yaml", ".yml", ".json", ".xml"};
1030        for (String ext : extensions) {
1031            File candidate = new File(workflowDir, path + ext);
1032            if (candidate.isFile()) {
1033                return candidate;
1034            }
1035        }
1036
1037        return null;
1038    }
1039
1040    /**
1041     * Loads the main workflow file with optional overlay support.
1042     */
1043    private ActionResult loadMainWorkflow(NodeGroupIIAR nodeGroupActor, File workflowFile, File overlayDir) {
1044        LOG.info("Loading workflow: " + workflowFile.getAbsolutePath());
1045        logToDb("cli", LogLevel.INFO, "Loading workflow: " + workflowFile.getName());
1046
1047        String loadArg;
1048        if (overlayDir != null) {
1049            // Pass both workflow path and overlay directory
1050            loadArg = "[\"" + workflowFile.getAbsolutePath() + "\", \"" + overlayDir.getAbsolutePath() + "\"]";
1051            LOG.fine("Loading with overlay: " + overlayDir.getAbsolutePath());
1052        } else {
1053            // Load without overlay
1054            loadArg = "[\"" + workflowFile.getAbsolutePath() + "\"]";
1055        }
1056
1057        return nodeGroupActor.callByActionName("readYaml", loadArg);
1058    }
1059
1060    private void printWorkflowList() {
1061        List<WorkflowDisplay> displays = scanWorkflowsForDisplay(workflowDir);
1062
1063        if (displays.isEmpty()) {
1064            System.out.println("No workflow files found under "
1065                + workflowDir.getAbsolutePath());
1066            return;
1067        }
1068
1069        System.out.println("Available workflows (directory: "
1070            + workflowDir.getAbsolutePath() + ")");
1071        System.out.println("-".repeat(90));
1072        System.out.printf("%-4s %-25s %-35s %s%n", "#", "File (-w)", "Path", "Workflow Name (in logs)");
1073        System.out.println("-".repeat(90));
1074        int index = 1;
1075        for (WorkflowDisplay display : displays) {
1076            String wfName = display.workflowName() != null ? display.workflowName() : "(no name)";
1077            System.out.printf("%2d.  %-25s %-35s %s%n",
1078                index++, display.baseName(), display.relativePath(), wfName);
1079        }
1080        System.out.println("-".repeat(90));
1081        System.out.println("Use -w <File> with the names shown in the 'File (-w)' column.");
1082    }
1083
1084    /**
1085     * Prints available cowfiles for cowsay output customization.
1086     */
1087    private void printAvailableCowfiles() {
1088        System.out.println("Available cowfiles for --cowfile option:");
1089        System.out.println("=".repeat(70));
1090        System.out.println();
1091
1092        // Get list from Cowsay library
1093        String[] listArgs = { "-l" };
1094        String cowList = com.github.ricksbrown.cowsay.Cowsay.say(listArgs);
1095
1096        // Split and format nicely
1097        String[] cowfiles = cowList.trim().split("\\s+");
1098        System.out.println("Total: " + cowfiles.length + " cowfiles");
1099        System.out.println();
1100
1101        // Print in columns
1102        int cols = 4;
1103        int colWidth = 17;
1104        for (int i = 0; i < cowfiles.length; i++) {
1105            System.out.printf("%-" + colWidth + "s", cowfiles[i]);
1106            if ((i + 1) % cols == 0) {
1107                System.out.println();
1108            }
1109        }
1110        if (cowfiles.length % cols != 0) {
1111            System.out.println();
1112        }
1113
1114        System.out.println();
1115        System.out.println("=".repeat(70));
1116        System.out.println("Usage: actor_iac.java run -d <dir> -w <workflow> --cowfile tux");
1117        System.out.println();
1118        System.out.println("Popular choices:");
1119        System.out.println("  tux         - Linux penguin (great for server work)");
1120        System.out.println("  dragon      - Majestic dragon");
1121        System.out.println("  stegosaurus - Prehistoric dinosaur");
1122        System.out.println("  turtle      - Slow and steady");
1123        System.out.println("  ghostbusters - Who you gonna call?");
1124    }
1125
1126    private static String getBaseName(String fileName) {
1127        int dotIndex = fileName.lastIndexOf('.');
1128        if (dotIndex > 0) {
1129            return fileName.substring(0, dotIndex);
1130        }
1131        return fileName;
1132    }
1133
1134    private static String relativize(Path base, Path target) {
1135        try {
1136            return base.relativize(target).toString();
1137        } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
1138            return target.toAbsolutePath().toString();
1139        }
1140    }
1141
1142    /**
1143     * Scans the immediate directory for workflow files (non-recursive).
1144     *
1145     * @since 2.12.1
1146     */
1147    private static List<WorkflowDisplay> scanWorkflowsForDisplay(File directory) {
1148        if (directory == null) {
1149            return List.of();
1150        }
1151
1152        try (Stream<Path> paths = Files.list(directory.toPath())) {
1153            Map<String, File> uniqueFiles = new LinkedHashMap<>();
1154            paths.filter(Files::isRegularFile)
1155                 .filter(path -> {
1156                     String name = path.getFileName().toString().toLowerCase();
1157                     return name.endsWith(".yaml") || name.endsWith(".yml")
1158                         || name.endsWith(".json") || name.endsWith(".xml");
1159                 })
1160                 .forEach(path -> uniqueFiles.putIfAbsent(path.toFile().getAbsolutePath(), path.toFile()));
1161
1162            Path basePath = directory.toPath();
1163            return uniqueFiles.values().stream()
1164                .map(file -> new WorkflowDisplay(
1165                    getBaseName(file.getName()),
1166                    relativize(basePath, file.toPath()),
1167                    extractWorkflowName(file)))
1168                .sorted(Comparator.comparing(WorkflowDisplay::baseName, String.CASE_INSENSITIVE_ORDER))
1169                .collect(Collectors.toList());
1170        } catch (IOException e) {
1171            System.err.println("Failed to scan workflows: " + e.getMessage());
1172            return List.of();
1173        }
1174    }
1175
1176    /**
1177     * Extracts the workflow name from a YAML/JSON/XML file.
1178     */
1179    private static String extractWorkflowName(File file) {
1180        String fileName = file.getName().toLowerCase();
1181        if (fileName.endsWith(".yaml") || fileName.endsWith(".yml")) {
1182            return extractNameFromYaml(file);
1183        } else if (fileName.endsWith(".json")) {
1184            return extractNameFromJson(file);
1185        }
1186        return null;
1187    }
1188
1189    /**
1190     * Extracts name field from YAML file using simple line parsing.
1191     */
1192    private static String extractNameFromYaml(File file) {
1193        try (java.io.BufferedReader reader = new java.io.BufferedReader(new java.io.FileReader(file))) {
1194            String line;
1195            while ((line = reader.readLine()) != null) {
1196                line = line.trim();
1197                // Look for "name: value" at the top level (not indented)
1198                if (line.startsWith("name:")) {
1199                    String value = line.substring(5).trim();
1200                    // Remove quotes if present
1201                    if ((value.startsWith("\"") && value.endsWith("\"")) ||
1202                        (value.startsWith("'") && value.endsWith("'"))) {
1203                        value = value.substring(1, value.length() - 1);
1204                    }
1205                    return value.isEmpty() ? null : value;
1206                }
1207                // Stop if we hit a steps: or other major section
1208                if (line.startsWith("steps:") || line.startsWith("vertices:")) {
1209                    break;
1210                }
1211            }
1212        } catch (IOException e) {
1213            // Ignore and return null
1214        }
1215        return null;
1216    }
1217
1218    /**
1219     * Extracts name field from JSON file.
1220     */
1221    private static String extractNameFromJson(File file) {
1222        try (java.io.FileReader reader = new java.io.FileReader(file)) {
1223            org.json.JSONTokener tokener = new org.json.JSONTokener(reader);
1224            org.json.JSONObject json = new org.json.JSONObject(tokener);
1225            return json.optString("name", null);
1226        } catch (Exception e) {
1227            // Ignore and return null
1228        }
1229        return null;
1230    }
1231
1232    /**
1233     * Record for displaying workflow information.
1234     */
1235    private static record WorkflowDisplay(String baseName, String relativePath, String workflowName) {}
1236
1237    /**
1238     * Gets the git commit hash of the specified directory.
1239     *
1240     * @param dir directory to check (uses current directory if null)
1241     * @return short git commit hash, or null if not a git repository
1242     */
1243    private String getGitCommit(File dir) {
1244        try {
1245            ProcessBuilder pb = new ProcessBuilder("git", "rev-parse", "--short", "HEAD");
1246            if (dir != null) {
1247                pb.directory(dir);
1248            }
1249            pb.redirectErrorStream(true);
1250            Process p = pb.start();
1251            String output = new String(p.getInputStream().readAllBytes()).trim();
1252            int exitCode = p.waitFor();
1253            return exitCode == 0 && !output.isEmpty() ? output : null;
1254        } catch (Exception e) {
1255            return null;
1256        }
1257    }
1258
1259    /**
1260     * Gets the git branch name of the specified directory.
1261     *
1262     * @param dir directory to check (uses current directory if null)
1263     * @return git branch name, or null if not a git repository
1264     */
1265    private String getGitBranch(File dir) {
1266        try {
1267            ProcessBuilder pb = new ProcessBuilder("git", "rev-parse", "--abbrev-ref", "HEAD");
1268            if (dir != null) {
1269                pb.directory(dir);
1270            }
1271            pb.redirectErrorStream(true);
1272            Process p = pb.start();
1273            String output = new String(p.getInputStream().readAllBytes()).trim();
1274            int exitCode = p.waitFor();
1275            return exitCode == 0 && !output.isEmpty() ? output : null;
1276        } catch (Exception e) {
1277            return null;
1278        }
1279    }
1280
1281    /**
1282     * Builds a command line string from the current options.
1283     *
1284     * @return command line string
1285     */
1286    private String buildCommandLine() {
1287        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder("run");
1288        if (workflowDir != null) {
1289            sb.append(" -d ").append(workflowDir.getPath());
1290        }
1291        if (workflowName != null) {
1292            sb.append(" -w ").append(workflowName);
1293        }
1294        if (inventoryFile != null) {
1295            sb.append(" -i ").append(inventoryFile.getPath());
1296        }
1297        if (groupName != null && !groupName.equals("all")) {
1298            sb.append(" -g ").append(groupName);
1299        }
1300        if (overlayDir != null) {
1301            sb.append(" -o ").append(overlayDir.getPath());
1302        }
1303        if (threads != 4) {
1304            sb.append(" -t ").append(threads);
1305        }
1306        if (verbose) {
1307            sb.append(" -v");
1308        }
1309        if (quiet) {
1310            sb.append(" -q");
1311        }
1312        if (limitHosts != null) {
1313            sb.append(" --limit ").append(limitHosts);
1314        }
1315        return sb.toString();
1316    }
1317
1318    /**
1319     * Gets the git commit hash of the actor-IaC installation.
1320     * This looks for a .git directory relative to where actor-IaC is running.
1321     *
1322     * @return short git commit hash, or null if not available
1323     */
1324    private String getActorIacCommit() {
1325        // Try to get commit from the actor-IaC source directory if running in dev mode
1326        try {
1327            String classPath = RunCLI.class.getProtectionDomain().getCodeSource().getLocation().getPath();
1328            File classFile = new File(classPath);
1329            // If running from target/classes, go up to project root
1330            if (classFile.getPath().contains("target")) {
1331                File projectRoot = classFile.getParentFile();
1332                while (projectRoot != null && !new File(projectRoot, ".git").exists()) {
1333                    projectRoot = projectRoot.getParentFile();
1334                }
1335                if (projectRoot != null) {
1336                    return getGitCommit(projectRoot);
1337                }
1338            }
1339        } catch (Exception e) {
1340            // Ignore
1341        }
1342        return null;
1343    }
1344}
